results.title: La Trobe Lifeskills. Diary 2
results.brief_description: An anonymous digital dairy created by a young person as part of a day long workshop run by ACMI. Each diary is scripted and a voiceover recorded by the individual young person. Some diaries use photographs brought in by the participant, but the primary visual content is often black and white, ‘stock’ footage of a poetic nature. At no point should the creator or school be positively identified when screening this work.

results.title: La Trobe Cottage [B&W]
results.creator_credit: National Trust, John Kingsford-Smith, Ampol Petroleum Ltd and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Heritage”.
A look at La Trobe Cottage, Victoria’s first Government House. Brought out from England, it was assembled on a foundation of hand-make bricks.

results.title: La Triche = the Cheat
results.brief_description:
Michel Verta, a police officer, lives happy in Bordeaux with his wife Nathalie and their child. From time to time he indulges in homosexual encounters. During a routine crime enquiry in a night-club, he meets Bernard, a musician, with whom he falls in love. Michel’s family finds out, and their reactions to the news are quite predictable. When Bernard accidentally kills a man who has been blackmailing him, the gay couple’s troubles are intensified, especially since Michel tries to illegally protect Bernard. The two lovers are caught in an increasing spiral of lies and despair.

Credits: Producer, Denise Petitdidier ; director, Yannick Bellon ; writers, Yannick Bellon, Alain Marcel, Remi Waterhouse ; photography, Houchang Baharlou ; music, Catherine Lara.
Cast: Victor Lanoux, Xavier Deluc, Anny Duperey, Michel Galabru, Valerie Mairesse, Michel Galabru.

results.title: La Traviata
results.creator_credit: Franco Zeffirelli, Tarak Ben Ammar, Radiotelevisione Italiana and Accent Films
results.brief_description: This is Zeffirelli’s lavish production of Verdi’s much-loved opera, “La Traviata”, starring Teresa Stratas and Placido Domingo. Violetta Valery is giving a party to celebrate her return to society after an illness - here she meets Alfredo, son of a wealthy merchant, and they fall in love. They live happily together until Alfredo’s father comes to Violetta and asks her to end the affair in order to spare his family further dishonour. The heartbreak destroys Violetta’s health completely, and Alfredo realises what Violetta has sacrificed - but it is too late!

results.title: La Traversee de Paris = Four Bags Full
results.brief_description:
A wealthy artist and a simple cab driver join up to transport four suitcases of blackmarket pork across Paris during the Occupation, dodging German roadblocks, hungry dogs and collaborators. Awards: Venice Film Festival 1956: Best Actor for Bourvil.

Credits: Producer, Yves Laplanche ; director, Claude Autant-Lara ; writers, Jean Aurenche, Pierre Bost ; photography, Jacques Natteau ; music, Rene Cloerec ; art direction, Max Douy.
Cast: Jean Gabin, Bourvil, Louis de Funes, Janette Batti, Robert Arnoux, Georgette Anys, Anouk Ferjac, Bernard Lajarrigue.

results.title: La Trace = the Trail
results.brief_description:
Joseph is a young Savoyard peasant who makes a living by crossing the Alps into Italy in the winter months selling his wares to the villagers. This story traces a winter’s itinerary as the man encounters various adventures in his always dangerous journey, but he remains oblivious to all the nuances and reverberations of social change going on around him. When he finally returns to his family after many months away, he discovers to his surprise that his village is now a part of France and it looks like a Savoyard would soon be sitting on the throne of a unified Italy. The film was originally shot in wide screen format. This copy is presented in standard screen ratio 3:4.

Credits: Producer, Claude Nedjar ; director, Bernard Favre ; writers, Bernard Favre, Bertrand Tavernier ; photography, Jean-Francis Gondre ; music, Marc Perrone, Nicola Piovani.
Cast: Richard Berry, Berangere Bonvoisin, Sophie Chemineau, Marc Perrone, Robin Renucci.

results.title: La Tete Contre les Murs = the Keepers
results.brief_description:
Francois Gerane is convinced his father, a famous lawyer, has killed his mother. Using as a pretext one of Francois’s small misdeed, Maitre Gerane has the rebellious young man committed to a mental home. Much of Franju’s first feature was shot in an actual asylum. The film is essentially a plea for a more sensible treatment of the mentally ill and the emotionally distressed, calling for much-needed widespread reforms. ‘La tete contre les murs’ is surely the most beautiful French film made since the war, and possibly the most beautiful French film ever made.” Reference: POSITIF, 1/7/1959.

Credits: Producer, Jerome Goulven ; director, Georges Franju ; writers, Jean-Charles Pichon, Jean-Pierre Mocky ; photography, Eugene Schuftan ; music, Maurice Jarre ; assistant director, Jacques Rouffio ; camera assistant, Claude Zidi.
Cast: Jean-Pierre Mocky, Anouk Aimee, Pierre Brasseur, Charles Aznavour, Paul Meurisse, Jean Galland, Edith Scob, Jean Ozenne.

results.title: La Sylphide
results.brief_description: La Sylphide, in diaphanous white costume and with shining wings, dances for the Scottish farmer James, in the first scene of this most famous and enduring ballet by August Bournonville. This production by the Royal Dutch Ballet was partly recorded in the atmosphere of live performance but essentially in the confines of an empty Royal Theatre. The orchestra is conducted by Paul Jorgensen.
